## Conditions.Condition.canMatchPartialContext() method

Determines if this condition can match the supplied context, even if the context is partial.

Returns true if: - The qualifier specified in the condition is not present in the context - The qualifier is present and matches the condition

Returns false if: - The qualifier is present in the context and does not match the condition

**Signature:**

```typescript
canMatchPartialContext(context: Context.IValidatedContextDecl, options?: Context.IContextMatchOptions): boolean;
```

</td></tr>
<tr><td>

options


</td><td>

[Context.IContextMatchOptions](./ts-res.context.icontextmatchoptions.md)


</td><td>

_(Optional)_ Options to use when matching the context.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

boolean

`true` if the condition can match the (possibly partial) context, `false` otherwise.
